actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend section 106 of title 4 of the United States Code relating to State taxation of the income of residents of another State.

summary.text: Provides that no State may levy or collect any income tax on income received from transactions occurring or services performed within a Federal area by any person who does not reside within such Federal area or within the State wherein such Federal area is located and who commutes to such employment, unless such State provides to such person material and proportionate benefits and protection. (Amends 4 U.S.C. 106)

titles.title: A bill to amend section 106 of title 4 of the United States Code relating to State taxation of the income of residents of another State.
